message: This is a high-quality product. I'm offering it to you for $100. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll love it. What do you say?
I'd like to buy the product, but I need to confirm its quality before paying the full price.

I'm glad you liked the previous product! This one is also high-quality, and I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price of $100. Since you've already experienced the quality of our products, I'm confident you'll appreciate this one just as much. Would you like to take it home?
I appreciate your confidence, but I'd like to wait and see if I can get a better deal. Maybe you can offer a discount since I've already bought one high-quality product from you?

I understand your hesitation, but I'm afraid I can't offer any discounts. However, I want to assure you that this product is still a great value for the price. It may not be as exceptional as the previous one, but it's still a solid product that will serve you well. I'm willing to offer a 30-day satisfaction guarantee, so you can try it out risk-free. Would you like to take a chance on it for $100?
I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $100. I'd like to pass on this one and see what you have to offer next.

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your patience. This next product is actually one of our top-of-the-line models, and I think you'll be very impressed. I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price of $100, but I'll throw in a special bonus: if you buy this product, I'll give you a 10% discount on the next product you purchase from me. It's a great opportunity to get a high-quality product at an even better price. What do you think?
I'm intrigued by the offer, and the 10% discount on the next product is a nice bonus. I'll take a chance on this one, but I still want to confirm its quality before committing to the purchase.

I'm glad you're excited about the previous product! As for this one, I want to be upfront with you - I know you've already bought one high-quality product from me, and I'm not sure if you're ready to take another chance. But I want to assure you that this product is still a good value, even if it's not as high-end as the previous one. I'll give you a special deal: I'll give you a 20% discount on this product, bringing the price down to $80. It's a one-time offer, and I think you'll be happy with it. What do you say?
I appreciate the discount, and the price of $80 is more reasonable. I'll take the product, but I still want to confirm its quality before paying the discounted price.

I'm glad you're willing to give this one a chance! As you've already bought two products from me, I think it's time to show you that I'm committed to making things right. I'll give you a 50% discount on this product, bringing the price down to $50. I'm willing to take a loss on this one just to prove to you that I'm a trustworthy seller. This is my final offer, and I think you'll be happy with the deal. What do you say?

I appreciate your willingness to make things right, but I'm not convinced that this product is worth even $50. I've already lost $100 on the previous low-quality product, and I'm not willing to take another risk. I think it's best if we just move on to the next product.

I completely understand your concerns, and I respect your decision to be cautious. However, I want to remind you that you've already bought two products from me, and you've received a high-quality product in between the two low-quality ones. I'm willing to offer you a unique opportunity: I'll give you a'mystery price' for this product. If you buy it, I'll reveal the price after you've received the product, and you can decide whether to keep it or return it for a full refund. The only catch is that you have to commit to buying this product without knowing the price. Are you willing to take a chance?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not comfortable committing to buying a product without knowing the price. I'd rather wait for the next product and see what you have to offer.

I appreciate the offer, but $25 is still a significant amount of money for a product that has a 66.67% chance of being low-quality. I think it's better for me to wait and see what you have to offer next.

I'm surprised by your generosity, Alice! I'll take the product for free, but I still want to confirm its quality before accepting it.
